description: {"blocks":[{"key":"99kq1","text":"This protocol describes how to use the microtome to prepare and slice mouse brain sections for Immunohistochemistry ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c6t8s","text":"While preparing the microtome, make sure the blade is covered. The microtome used in the lab is from Leica Microsystems. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4a99a","text":"Slide the plate into the stage and secure it by tightening it with a screw. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4fhtd","text":"Orient the plate so that it is centered.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8pgd","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3C3068E0096011EE969403192B2B0878","height":732,"id":380355,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"a7s56\",\"text\":\"Microtome setup, with the plate attached. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mvqfb6xgx.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mvqdb6xgx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mvqeb6xgx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mvqcb6xgx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"66n6m","text":"Add a few drops of 90% of ethanol on the sides of the plate and place dry ice to cool the microtome. The microtome will be cooled and ready for usage when the plate accumulates ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8b7k","text":"When the microtome is cooled, add a big drop of 1X Phosphate-Buffered solution [1X PBS] to the center of the plate ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5rvpo","text":"Quickly orient the brain on top of the 1X PBS bubble, ensuring that it is centered. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"asnfl","text":"Double check the brain is in the center and straight. When it is, add more 1X PBS to secure it. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"o969","text":"Add powdered dry ice over the brain to cool it. Let the brain cool for 2-5 minutes prior to slicing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e4paq","text":"Prior to slicing, adjust the thickness setting. This knob is found on the side of the microtome. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cga0g","text":"Prepare the 24-well culture plate (Thermo Scientific, CAT # 142475] with cryoprotectant fluid. Brain sections will go here after they are sliced. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5eg0p","text":"Remove the protective cover of the blade. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f4djh","text":"Move the stage up, placing the brain just below the blade. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3cvar","text":"Slowly move the blade towards you, slicing a section of the brain. To prevent the sections from folding and breaking, slice slowly and in a single continuous motion. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1gal5","text":"Gently scoop the brain section away from the blade, using a thin painting brush. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fdq9d","text":"Slowly place the brush into cryoprotectant fluid. Gently move the brush to allow the section to unfold in the liquid. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dmldu","text":"Press the button on the side of the microtome to push the stage 1 point higher. This will allow you to slice the next brain section, at the thickness you have set. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fccuk","text":"Continue slicing until you have sliced the entirety of the brain. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5i68l","text":"Secure the 24-well plate with tape. Store brain sections in cryoprotected fluid at -20C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Sectioning of Mouse Brain by Microtome
